alert.note: Alert for McMinn (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, McMinn and Polk. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour or two. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ducktown, Etowah, Englewood, Hiwassee Ocoee State Park, Reliance, Archville and William L. Davenport Refuge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
